title: Mount Rainier National Park: Calendar
body: Calendar       Details of Ranger-led Evening Programs held throughout the park are listed in the schedule of events calendar. Evening programs last approximately 45 minutes. For the full schedule of all interpretive programs see Ranger-led Programs.          Keyword       By Date     Start Date      End Date          Search         Upcoming Events    Showing 19 results    Show ALL instances of recurring events   RSS Feed      Mount Rainier National Park Climate Change: From Mt. Rainier to Alien Worlds      Time: 7:30 PM Location: White River Campground Amphitheater  Fees: All programs are free.     Monday, August 8, 2016 Every Monday Weekly  from 07/11/2016 to 08/29/2016 Boldly embark on a voyage to explore strange new worlds in this 45 minute talk with Ranger Raphael. View Details      Mount Rainier National Park Sleeping Giant      Location: White River Campground Amphitheater  Fees: All programs are free.     Tuesday, August 9, 2016 Every Tuesday Weekly  from 07/12/2016 to 08/30/2016 Mount Rainier has been called the most dangerous volcano in the U.S. Find out how we prepare for its possible dangers. View Details      Mount Rainier National Park Are the Bears Okay?      Time: 7:30 PM Location: White River Campground Amphitheater Fees: All programs are free.     Wednesday, August 10, 2016 Every Wednesday Weekly  from 07/06/2016 to 08/31/2016 Help write the story of a Mount Rainier bear, choosing each adventure along the way. View Details      Mount Rainier National Park History Comes Alive      Location: Paradise Inn lobby Fees: free     Friday, August 12, 2016 National parks tell stories of people-past and present. Meet some characters from Mount Rainier National Park's past and hear their stories. View Details      Mount Rainier National Park Music in the American Wild      Location: Ohanapecosh Campground ampitheater Fees: free     Friday, August 12, 2016 A group of eleven composers and seven performers will be touring seven national parks during the Centennial honoring our country's grandest locations. View Details      Mount Rainier National Park Tremendous Tales of Tacobud      Time: 7:30 PM Location: White River Campground Amphitheater  Fees: All programs are free.     Friday, August 12, 2016 Every Friday Weekly  from 07/08/2016 to 09/02/2016 Join Ranger Logan for an evening filled with Mount Rainier storytelling, with a deeper look into why we tell tall tales. View Details      Mount Rainier National Park Washington Trails Association - Centennial Trail Maintenance      Location: various     Friday, August 12, 2016 Every Sunday Weekly & Every Friday Weekly & Every Saturday Weekly  from 06/03/2016 to 09/30/2016 Washington Trails Association (WTA) will lead trail construction and repair projects to take the park's magnificent trails into the next century for the next generation of park hikers. View Details      Mount Rainier National Park A Journey Up the White River      Time: 7:30 PM Location: White River Campground Amphitheater  Fees: All programs are free.     Saturday, August 13, 2016 Every Saturday Weekly  from 07/09/2016 to 09/03/2016 For thousands of years, the White River has been the corridor that brings families to Mount Rainier. But how have the mountain, the river, and the visitors changed each other over time? View Details      Mount Rainier National Park History Comes Alive      Location: Cougar Rock Campground Fees: free     Saturday, August 13, 2016 National parks tell stories of people-past and present. Meet some characters from Mount Rainier National Park's past and hear their stories. View Details      Mount Rainier National Park Mount Rainier National Park Associates - Centennial Volunteer Project      Location: various     Saturday, August 13, 2016 For information on this trail maintenance project and to sign up, contact MRNPA at mrnpa.org or volunteer@mrnpa.org. View Details      Mount Rainier National Park Mount Rainier National Park Associates Centennial Volunteer Project      Location: Mount Rainier National Park     Saturday, August 13, 2016 For information on this trail maintenance project and to sign up contact MRNPA at mrnpa.org or volunteer@mrnpa.org View Details      Mount Rainier National Park Music in the American Wild      Location: Plaza area outside Jackson Visitor Center Fees: free     Saturday, August 13, 2016 A group of eleven composers and seven performers will be touring seven national parks during the Centennial honoring our country's grandest locations. View Details      Mount Rainier National Park Legends of the Land      Time: 7:30 PM Location: White River Campground Amphitheater  Fees: All programs are free.     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Every Sunday Weekly  from 07/10/2016 to 08/28/2016 Native American stories are more than just entertaining. Learn about the unique connection between Mount Rainier’s past and the first people to experience its tumultuous moods. View Details      Mount Rainier National Park Music in the American Wild      Location: Sunrise Fees: free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 A group of eleven composers and seven performers will be touring seven national parks during the Centennial honoring our country's grandest locations. View Details      Mount Rainier National Park Shadows of the Past      Location: Longmire Fees: free     Saturday, August 20, 2016 Meet the people who explored, settled, climbed and protected Mount Rainier more than 100 years ago. View Details      Mount Rainier National Park Celebrate Rainier!      Location: Longmire, Paradise, Ohanapecosh and Sunrise Fees: free     Thursday, August 25, 2016 Mount Rainier National Park Celebrates the National Park Service Centennial  View Details      Mount Rainier National Park Fee Free Day: National Park Service Birthday Weekend      Location: Mount Rainier National Park Fees: Free Admission     Thursday, August 25, 2016 All entrance fees are waived August 25-28 in celebration of the National Park Service's 100th Birthday! The National Park Service was created on August 25, 1916. View Details      Mount Rainier National Park NPS Centennial Free Entrance Days      Location: Mount Rainier National Park Fees: free     Thursday, August 25, 2016 NPS Centennial Free Entrance Days for National Park Service's 100th Birthday. View Details      Mount Rainier National Park Centennial Star Party      Time: 8:45 PM Location: Paradise Inn Fees: All programs are free     Saturday, August 27, 2016 Join park rangers and astronomy volunteers for a memorable night of star gazing.
